subdefinitions.definition: To engage in combat with; to oppose physically, to contest with.
examples: My grandfather fought the Nazis in World War II.

subdefinitions.definition: To conduct or engage in (battle, warfare, a cause, etc.).
examples: Our soldiers fought the battle just over that hill.

subdefinitions.definition: To contend in physical conflict, either singly or in war, battle etc.
examples: A wounded animal will fight tooth and nail; relentless, savage and murderous.

subdefinitions.definition: To contend in physical conflict with each other, either singly or in war, battle etc.
examples: The two boxers have been fighting for more than half an hour.

subdefinitions.definition: To cause to fight; to manage or manoeuvre in a fight.
examples: to fight cocks; to fight one’s ship

definitions.definition: To strive for something; to campaign or contend for success.
examples: He fought for the Democrats in the last election.

definitions.definition: To try to overpower ; to fiercely counteract .
examples: The government pledged to fight corruption.

definitions.definition: Of colours or other design elements: to clash ; to fail to harmonize .

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To strive for something; to campaign or contend for success.
( transitive ) To try to overpower ; to fiercely counteract .
( intransitive ) Of colours or other design elements: to clash ; to fail to harmonize .
